title: Impact Drilling Contractors
content:
I have posted this font on another forum several times, nobody knows it...   
Lets see how good you guys are!   
Warick.... !["drilling"](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314040920im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/10865.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Typewriter font - Love Letter Typewriter {Sam}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314040920/http:/www.typophile.com/node/239 "Go to previous forum topic") [Nicola CoffeeType id ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314040920/http:/www.typophile.com/node/220 "Go to next forum topic")
author: wizzard64

comments.content: Yves? Are you sleeping? Chesh? Stephen? I can't find it. Koloss was my first thought, but it isn't close enough. Unless you can change several characters.

Hi Tiff, I saw the thread but couldn't find anything yet.   
What, didn't you hear my brain cells snap, crackle and   
pop? =D

Could it be a modified (extended or horizontally stretched) Radiant?   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/radiant-ef/radiant-display-condensed-no1/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314040920/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/radiant-ef/radiant-display-condensed-no1/)   
   
David

Boy, I'm stumped. I'm guessing it isn't available digitally, like it's only a sign-painter's font. Maybe it's in one of Dan Solo's books? Also, he recently released digital versions of his fonts. Take a look at the [Typographica](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314040920/http:/typographi.ca/000510.php) post on the subject.
No, it's not any sort of Radiant modification. The characters in the sample have slightly rounded edges, and the G is very different from Radiant.
The nearest I have found is Gothic, but that is only close ![:-(](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314040920im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/sad.gif)

It looks to me to be a sign painter's hand variant of one of the above. I don't know if you will match it exactly. Possibly something at [LetterHead Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314040920/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/) might be close. May even want to consult with them on this one!

This one bugged me, so I did some experimentation with E+F Radiant Display Condensed No. 1. There is so many versions of Radiant out there, there might be a better match, but its close enough to close the case in my opinion. Scaled 70 % on the horizontal and with some extra outline/fatness and rounded corners. Voil

The font was "cut" by a signwriter, using signblazer.... And as far as I know, not modified, the original graphic was a photopraph, touched up a little for clarity.. ![original photo cropped](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314040920im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/11146.jpg)

Warick, made this quickie unicase   
Koloss imitator...   
   
I think Ola is right on...   
   
This version is...   
Solely for fun/personal use...   
   
bj ![typ.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314040920im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/11154.jpg)
Jesus... Yves, where can I find gold/US$? Not bad for a married designer ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314040920im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

Here's the [gold](http://web.archive.org/web/20080314040920/http:/www.orangeitalic.com/luxury/collect02.html). About the US$: I'm afraid you'll   
have to cough up a lot of those to get that gold.   
Sorryabouthat.   
   
=D
